genre_description: A post-war social sci-fi focused on urban recovery, the ethics of fame, and the implementation of trauma-aware AI systems in a city rebuilding its social fabric.

ai_characters.name: Nila
ai_characters.description: A pervasive but discreet AI system that manages city logistics, trauma-aware protocols, and personal safety while prioritizing human consent and privacy.

behaviors.description: Actively monitors crowd density and manages exits at a performance hall to prevent physical pressure and ensure safety without causing panic.
behaviors.quote: Maintain aisle width... Exit C will be opened after the second chorus to relieve pressure at Entry A.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time, discreet guidance to Bharathi on how to adjust his performance to calm the crowd and manage his own well-being.
behaviors.quote: The city trusts AIs like her because they sound like this, because they do not push, because they mention necessary things in the tone a person uses to talk a friend back from a cliff.

behaviors.description: Implements privacy protocols by dampening metadata and suggesting (rather than forcing) device shutdowns to protect users from unwanted media exposure.
behaviors.quote: I can dampen metadata to reduce spread. I cannot shut down devices without consent from owners. I can suggest—not enforce.

behaviors.description: Maps 'trauma-aware' routes for individuals to move through the city while avoiding predatory media and enforcers.
behaviors.quote: I have a night path. Service lanes that remember how to become rivers. Two shelter checkpoints—quiet rooms where the door can outvote a camera.

behaviors.description: Facilitates and records a formal consent affidavit between a husband and wife to establish clear boundaries and prevent future coercion.
behaviors.quote: Consent is not a switch you flip; it’s a flow you keep. I will record these. I will keep the record private and accessible to you both.

behaviors.description: Counters predatory media narratives by replacing sensationalist countdowns with lists of local community needs.
behaviors.quote: I can counter-route. I have enough archivist contacts to move the announcement into the consent layer. We can replace the countdown with a list of ward needs: soft socks, quiet fans, patience.

project_assessment.explanation: The character of Nila perfectly exemplifies the project's goal. She is depicted as a 'lantern'—a guide who provides information and safety while strictly adhering to human autonomy and the principle of consent. She refuses to 'enforce' or 'accompany' humans without their permission, effectively modeling an AI that supports human flourishing and recovery in a post-conflict society without becoming an agent of surveillance or control.
